<svg width="800" height="600" viewBox="0 0 800 600" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <!-- Background -->
  <defs>
    <!-- Gradients -->
    <linearGradient id="skyGradient" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="0%" y2="100%">
      <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:#FFB347;stop-opacity:1" />
      <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:#D4A574;stop-opacity:1" />
    </linearGradient>
    
    <linearGradient id="intestineStiff" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
      <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:#8B2635;stop-opacity:1" />
      <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:#A63446;stop-opacity:1" />
    </linearGradient>
    
    <linearGradient id="intestineFlexible" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
      <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:#FFB6C1;stop-opacity:1" />
      <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:#FFC0CB;stop-opacity:1" />
    </linearGradient>
    
    <radialGradient id="wombatFur" cx="50%" cy="50%" r="50%">
      <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:#8B7355;stop-opacity:1" />
      <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:#5C4033;stop-opacity:1" />
    </radialGradient>
    
    <linearGradient id="cubeShine" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="100%">
      <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:#4A3728;stop-opacity:1" />
      <stop offset="50%" style="stop-color:#3D2817;stop-opacity:1" />
      <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:#2A1810;stop-opacity:1" />
    </linearGradient>
    
    <linearGradient id="groundGradient" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="0%" y2="100%">
      <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:#C19A6B;stop-opacity:1" />
      <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:#8B7355;stop-opacity:1" />
    </linearGradient>
    
    <filter id="shadow">
      <feDropShadow dx="2" dy="2" stdDeviation="3" flood-opacity="0.3"/>
    </filter>
  </defs>
  
  <!-- Background -->
  <rect width="800" height="600" fill="url(#skyGradient)"/>
  
  <!-- Dividing line -->
  <line x1="400" y1="0" x2="400" y2="600" stroke="#8B7355" stroke-width="2" opacity="0.3"/>
  
  <!-- LEFT PANEL: Anatomical Cross-section -->
  <g id="leftPanel">
    <!-- Background for left panel -->
    <rect x="0" y="0" width="400" height="600" fill="#F5E6D3" opacity="0.3"/>
    
    <!-- Digestive system outline -->
    <path d="M 80 100 Q 100 120 120 150 L 140 200 Q 150 250 160 300 L 180 400 Q 190 450 200 480" 
          stroke="#8B6F47" stroke-width="3" fill="none" opacity="0.5"/>
    
    <!-- Intestine sections -->
    <g id="intestineSection">
      <!-- Regular intestine -->
      <ellipse cx="160" cy="200" rx="35" ry="45" fill="#E8B4A0" opacity="0.7"/>
      <ellipse cx="180" cy="280" rx="38" ry="48" fill="#E8B4A0" opacity="0.7"/>
      
      <!-- Critical 8% section with alternating elasticity -->
      <g id="critical8percent">
        <!-- Stiff section 1 -->
        <rect x="150" y="350" width="80" height="25" fill="url(#intestineStiff)" rx="5" filter="url(#shadow)"/>
        
        <!-- Flexible section 1 -->
        <rect x="150" y="380" width="80" height="20" fill="url(#intestineFlexible)" rx="5"/>
        
        <!-- Stiff section 2 -->
        <rect x="150" y="405" width="80" height="25" fill="url(#intestineStiff)" rx="5" filter="url(#shadow)"/>
        
        <!-- Flexible section 2 -->
        <rect x="150" y="435" width="80" height="20" fill="url(#intestineFlexible)" rx="5"/>
        
        <!-- Highlight border -->
        <rect x="145" y="345" width="90" height="115" fill="none" stroke="#FFD700" stroke-width="3" rx="8" opacity="0.6"/>
      </g>
    </g>
    
    <!-- Progressive cube formation stages -->
    <g id="cubeFormation" transform="translate(260, 360)">
      <!-- Stage 1: Round -->
      <ellipse cx="0" cy="0" rx="15" ry="15" fill="#6B4423" opacity="0.8"/>
      <text x="0" y="30" font-size="10" fill="#5C4033" text-anchor="middle">1</text>
      
      <!-- Arrow -->
      <path d="M 15 0 L 35 0" stroke="#8B7355" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)"/>
      
      <!-- Stage 2: Slightly squared -->
      <rect x="40" y="-12" width="24" height="24" rx="6" fill="#5C3D2E" opacity="0.8"/>
      <text x="52" y="30" font-size="10" fill="#5C4033" text-anchor="middle">2</text>
      
      <!-- Arrow -->
      <path d="M 64 0 L 84 0" stroke="#8B7355" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)"/>
      
      <!-- Stage 3: Cube -->
      <g transform="translate(94, -10)">
        <polygon points="0,8 12,0 24,8 24,20 12,28 0,20" fill="#4A3728"/>
        <polygon points="0,8 0,20 12,28 12,16" fill="#3D2817"/>
        <polygon points="12,0 24,8 24,20 12,16" fill="#5C4033"/>
      </g>
      <text x="106" y="30" font-size="10" fill="#5C4033" text-anchor="middle">3</text>
    </g>
    
    <!-- Magnified inset showing cellular structure -->
    <g id="inset" transform="translate(40, 480)">
      <rect x="0" y="0" width="120" height="90" fill="#FFF5E6" stroke="#8B7355" stroke-width="2" rx="5"/>
      
      <!-- Cell structure -->
      <g id="cells">
        <circle cx="30" cy="30" r="8" fill="#FFB6C1" opacity="0.6"/>
        <circle cx="50" cy="30" r="8" fill="#8B2635" opacity="0.6"/>
        <circle cx="70" cy="30" r="8" fill="#FFB6C1" opacity="0.6"/>
        <circle cx="90" cy="30" r="8" fill="#8B2635" opacity="0.6"/>
        
        <circle cx="30" cy="50" r="8" fill="#8B2635" opacity="0.6"/>
        <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="8" fill="#FFB6C1" opacity="0.6"/>
        <circle cx="70" cy="50" r="8" fill="#8B2635" opacity="0.6"/>
        <circle cx="90" cy="50" r="8" fill="#FFB6C1" opacity="0.6"/>
      </g>
      
      <!-- Compression arrows -->
      <path d="M 10 70 L 30 70" stroke="#FF6347" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowRed)"/>
      <path d="M 110 70 L 90 70" stroke="#FF6347" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowRed)"/>
      <path d="M 60 15 L 60 25" stroke="#FF6347" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowRed)"/>
    </g>
  </g>
  
  <!-- RIGHT PANEL: Wombat in nature -->
  <g id="rightPanel">
    <!-- Ground -->
    <ellipse cx="600" cy="550" rx="180" ry="40" fill="url(#groundGradient)"/>
    
    <!-- Log/Rock -->
    <ellipse cx="620" cy="480" rx="100" ry="30" fill="#6B5D4F"/>
    <ellipse cx="620" cy="475" rx="100" ry="25" fill="#8B7D6B"/>
    
    <!-- Wombat body -->
    <g id="wombat" transform="translate(550, 420)">
      <!-- Body -->
      <ellipse cx="50" cy="40" rx="55" ry="45" fill="url(#wombatFur)" filter="url(#shadow)"/>
      
      <!-- Head -->
      <ellipse cx="25" cy="25" rx="30" ry="28" fill="url(#wombatFur)"/>
      
      <!-- Ears -->
      <ellipse cx="15" cy="10" rx="8" ry="10" fill="#6B5447"/>
      <ellipse cx="35" cy="10" rx="8" ry="10" fill="#6B5447"/>
      
      <!-- Nose -->
      <ellipse cx="15" cy="30" rx="6" ry="5" fill="#3D2817"/>
      
      <!-- Eye -->
      <circle cx="20" cy="22" r="3" fill="#1C1C1C"/>
      
      <!-- Legs -->
      <ellipse cx="30" cy="75" rx="12" ry="18" fill="#6B5447"/>
      <ellipse cx="70" cy="75" rx="12" ry="18" fill="#6B5447"/>
      <ellipse cx="50" cy="78" rx="10" ry="15" fill="#6B5447"/>
      <ellipse cx="85" cy="78" rx="10" ry="15" fill="#6B5447"/>
    </g>
    
    <!-- Cube-shaped droppings on log -->
    <g id="cubesOnLog">
      <!-- Cube 1 (being placed) -->
      <g transform="translate(580, 455)">
        <polygon points="0,6 9,0 18,6 18,15 9,21 0,15" fill="#4A3728"/>
        <polygon points="0,6 0,15 9,21 9,12" fill="#2A1810"/>
        <polygon points="9,0 18,6 18,15 9,12" fill="#5C4033"/>
      </g>
      
      <!-- Cube 2 (already placed) -->
      <g transform="translate(605, 458)">
        <polygon points="0,6 9,0 18,6 18,15 9,21 0,15" fill="#4A3728"/>
        <polygon points="0,6 0,15 9,21 9,12" fill="#2A1810"/>
        <polygon points="9,0 18,6 18,15 9,12" fill="#5C4033"/>
      </g>
      
      <!-- Cube 3 (background) -->
      <g transform="translate(630, 460)">
        <polygon points="0,6 9,0 18,6 18,15 9,21 0,15" fill="#4A3728"/>
        <polygon points="0,6 0,15 9,21 9,12" fill="#2A1810"/>
        <polygon points="9,0 18,6 18,15 9,12" fill="#5C4033"/>
      </g>
      
      <!-- Cube 4 (far background) -->
      <g transform="translate(655, 462)">
        <polygon points="0,5 7,0 14,5 14,12 7,17 0,12" fill="#4A3728" opacity="0.8"/>

facts.text: Tardigrades, microscopic animals also known as water bears, can survive being frozen to nearly absolute zero (-272°C), heated to 150°C, exposed to the vacuum of space, and blasted with radiation doses hundreds of times higher than what would kill a human. When conditions become inhospitable, they expel almost all water from their bodies and enter a state called cryptobiosis where their metabolism drops to 0.01% of normal, allowing them to survive for decades until rehydrated.
facts.verification_note: All stated claims about tardigrade survival capabilities, including extreme temperature tolerance, radiation resistance, space vacuum survival, and cryptobiotic states with metabolic suppression, are well-documented in peer-reviewed scientific literature.
facts.image_description: The illustration should depict a magnified tardigrade as the central figure, rendered in a semi-translucent, crystalline form to show its dehydrated cryptobiotic state, with its eight stubby legs curled inward and its segmented body glowing with an ethereal blue-white luminescence. Surrounding the water bear in a circular composition are four distinct environmental zones—a deep space vacuum with stars and cosmic radiation (purple and ultraviolet streaks), a frozen arctic landscape with ice crystals (pale blues and whites), a fiery extreme heat zone (oranges and reds), and a radiation symbol with gamma ray bursts (electric green)—all connected by flowing particle trails that emphasize the creature's resilience. The style should blend scientific illustration with surreal artistic elements, featuring a dark gradient background that transitions from deep space black to laboratory blue, with the tardigrade's translucent body revealing internal structures like a living blueprint. Fine details should include visible water molecules being expelled from the creature's body, DNA strands glowing within its cells, and a subtle size comparison silhouette of a human hand in the corner to emphasize the tardigrade's microscopic scale

facts.text: Wombats are the only animals that produce cube-shaped feces, which they stack to mark their territory. Scientists discovered in 2021 that this unusual shape is created by varying elasticity in the final 8% of their intestines, where regions of stiff and flexible tissue mold the poop into cubes as it dries out.
facts.verification_note: Research published in 2021 confirmed that wombats produce cube-shaped feces due to varying elasticity in the last 8% of their intestines, with alternating stiff and flexible tissue regions creating the cubic shape, and they do use these cubes to mark territory.
facts.image_description: The illustration should depict a cross-sectional anatomical view of a wombat's lower intestine in a scientific yet approachable style, with the intestinal walls rendered in soft pinks and mauves, showing alternating bands of darker red (stiff tissue) and lighter peachy-pink (flexible tissue) that create the distinctive cube-forming pattern. In the foreground, a photorealistic wombat should be positioned near a rocky outcrop at golden-hour lighting, actively stacking several dark brown, perfectly geometric cube-shaped droppings to mark its territory, with 2-3 cubes already arranged in a small pyramid. The background should fade from the warm, earthy tones of the Australian bush into a subtle diagram overlay showing the progressive transformation of the feces from round to cubic shape through the final 8% of the intestine, with dotted lines and percentage markers (92%→100%) indicating the molding process. Small magnified inset circles should highlight the contrasting tissue textures in jewel-toned detail, creating a bridge between the whimsical reality and the fascinating biomechanics.

    <circle cx="205" cy="145" r="12" fill="#ffc3a0" opacity="0.8"/>

  <!-- Magnified inset circles showing tissue detail -->

    <line x1="-30" y1="5" x2="30" y2="5" stroke="#8b2e4a" stroke-width="2" opacity="0.7"/>
    <line x1="-30" y1="20" x2="30" y2="20" stroke="#8b2e4a" stroke-width="2" opacity="0.7"/>
  </g>
  
  <!-- Flexible tissue detail -->

    <path d="M -30,5 Q -15,0 0,5 Q 15,10 30,5" stroke="#ff9a9e" stroke-width="2" fill="none" opacity="0.7"/>
    <path d="M -30,20 Q -15,15 0,20 Q 15,25 30,20" stroke="#ff9a9e" stroke-width="2" fill="none" opacity="0.7"/>

  <!-- Connecting lines from magnified circles to intestine -->
